dataTypes.name: Text
dataTypes.description: Storing alphanumeric characters

dataTypes.name: Text Area
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter up to 255 characters on separate lines
dataTypes.notes: When you encrypt the Name field, enhanced lookups are automatically enabled. Enhanced lookups improve the user’s experience by searching only through records that have been looked up recently, and not all existing records. Switching to enhanced lookups is a one-way change. You can’t go back to standard lookups, even if you disable encryption.

dataTypes.name: Text Area Long
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter up to 131,072 characters on separate lines

dataTypes.name: Text Area Rich
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter formatted text, add images and links. Up to 131,072 characters on separate lines.

dataTypes.name: Text Encrypted
dataTypes.description: Storing sensitive data that needs to be encrypted, using classic encryption AES 128

dataTypes.name: RichTextArea
dataTypes.description: Storing formatted text with styling  and images

dataTypes.name: Number
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter any number. Leading zeros are removed

dataTypes.name: AutoNumber
dataTypes.description: A system-generated sequence number,  automatically incremented for each new record.

dataTypes.name: Currency
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter a dollar or other currency amount and automatically formats the field as a currency amount. This can be useful if you export data to Excel or another spreadsheet

dataTypes.name: Email
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter an email address, which is validated to ensure proper format. If this field is specified for a contact or lead, users can choose the address when clicking Send an Email. Note that custom email addresses cannot be used for mass emails

dataTypes.name: Phone
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter any phone number. Automatically formats it as a phone number.

dataTypes.name: Percent
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter a percentage number, for example, '10' and automatically adds the percent sign to the number

dataTypes.name: Formula
dataTypes.description: Storing calculations or combine data from other fields. A read-only field that derives its value from a formula expression you define. The formula field is updated when any of the source fields change.
dataTypes.shield: restricted, supported: that derive values solely from encrypted fields and deterministic, non-encrypted fields. Non-deterministic fields/functions: NOW(), TODAY(), RAND() not supported.

dataTypes.name: File
dataTypes.description: Storing File and Attachments

dataTypes.name: URL
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter any valid website address. When users click on the field, the URL will open in a separate browser window

dataTypes.name: Date
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter a date or pick a date from a popup calendar

dataTypes.name: Time
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter a local time. For example, 2:40 PM, 14:40, 14:40:00, and 14:40:50.600 are all valid times for this field

dataTypes.name: Date/Time
dataTypes.description: Allows users to enter a date and time, or pick a date from a popup calendar. When users click a date in the pop-up, that date and the current time are entered into the Date/Time field

dataTypes.name: Checkbox
dataTypes.description: Allows users to select a True (checked) or False (unchecked) value

dataTypes.name: GeoLocation
dataTypes.description: Allows users to define locations. Includes latitude and longitude components, and can be used to calculate distance

dataTypes.name: Picklist
dataTypes.description: Allows users to select a value from a list you define.

dataTypes.name: Multi-Select Picklist
dataTypes.description: Allows users to select multiple values from a list you define.

dataTypes.name: Lookup Relationship
dataTypes.description: Storing  reference to a record in another object

dataTypes.name: External Lookup Relationship
dataTypes.description: Creates a relationship that links this object to an external object whose data is stored outside the Salesforce org.

dataTypes.name: Master-Detail Relationship
dataTypes.description: Storing  hierarchical relationship between 2 objects

dataTypes.name: Roll-Up Summary
dataTypes.description: A read-only field that displays the sum, minimum, or maximum value of a field in a related list or the record count of all records listed in a related list.
